Articles.Content:
CHAPTER 14: CONVOY AT DUNA

Captains log, entry 214: I can't believe it, that device actually works. The entirety of the Kraken forces around Kerbin, Mun, and Minmus are gone. Hell, I heard Lengas say he spotted some bright green pulse in the direction of Kerbin, so this thing must be powerful. From my understanding, though, we aren't out of the frying pan just yet. That device only covered Kerbin's SOI, but we know already that there are other Kraken ships around. The Odysseus incident is proof positive of that, but we also know of more ships headed towards Kerbin, but they're gonna take a few years to arrive. I don't think they expected that bomb to happen, so they thought later reinforcements would be better? I don't know, I'm not a Kraken.

Unfortunately, the device crippled the Libra LBR-030-A beyond any repair, and as a result, Shepdon Kerman has died. Damn, Lemburry must be gutted, those two were best friends from the day they met at recruitment. I know I'm feeling bad about this. At least Shepdon wasn't alone when he passed away. He will be missed.

...

Captain's log, entry 215: 3 days since my last log. Nothing much has happened. Doc says Dilcott is making some progress with the psychotherapy. Malrick's hand is fully healed, so he can work properly again. Lengas won the Lonestar Skrabble championship (grr...). And finally, Bill deduced that it's going to take another 2 months for the convoy to reach us.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Captain's log, entry 216: 6 weeks since my last log? Geez, things are getting boring around here. We should be off exploring the other planets, not sitting here on our backsides waiting for a bunch of ships to show their faces.

That said, we're probably going to see some action when those vessels arrive, or at least a few days afterwards. Kraken units followed them, the conniving fiends. Considering we're the largest armed ship out here, we'll most likely end up acting as the flagship. Damn, I hope it doesn't come to that. The Aegis is a torpedo frigate, flanked by, what, 5 Reaper fighters, plus 2 Callisto frigates? And what are we? An exploration cruiser that has lasers, one of which is still defunct after a power-up test the other day!

Granted, we have the best when it comes to long-range fights, but if anything gets close enough to stop us from being effective, we're finished.

I don't want that.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Captain's log, entry 217: We got a transmission from the lead resupply ship. They want us to stay in our present orbit, and they'll rendezvous with us in 12 hours. Like we were going to move. We couldn't move even if we wanted too, anyway, seeing as Lengas and Malrick are fixing the expansion nozzle for the fusion engine. I swear, if that micrometeorite had been just a few metres in the wrong direction, there would be no Lonestar to resupply.

What is it with micrometeorites and us getting lucky breaks with them? Odysseus got scraped in Laythe orbit, now this? Whatever, as long as we're alive.

Dilcott is improving dramatically. Handorf's psychotherapy sessions must really be fantastic. I might see him, myself, I'm starting to feel a bit out of it.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Captain's log, entry 218: They're here. We can finally fix Lonestar up properly. Almost every old system is going. Granted, almost every old system need not be replaced after the work we did fixing it all, but it's better to have fresh equipment. No-one really wants the life support machine suddenly spewing carbon monoxide out. The fuel vessel will be docking after we have the new systems installed. One of those new systems happens to be an advanced targeting computer for the lasers. This thing is apparently hyper-accurate out to 1,000,000km away. Very handy, I guess,

Apparently there's also a ship here to pick up Dilcott and his guys. I don't know what exactly they're going to do on that ship that is different to what they're doing here, but oh well.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Captain's log, entry 219: There's a full-blown Krakensbane device on that ship here to pick Dilcott up. I think it's pretty damn apparent what he and his guys are going to be doing. Now that Lonestar is back in shape, I think it's time we got on with this crew transfer. It's been good having them on board.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lengas, you taking those two over to their new ship now?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, I'm just making sure that all the new systems are fully functional.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Fair enough, that was an intensive retrofit.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“If anything goes nuts, just say and I'll give you a hand.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I think everything is fine. Bilnard, Rodrin, you coming?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, one moment.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You two be safe. Tell me what our new ship is like when you get there.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“But of course.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'll get your seat warmed up, if there is a seat warmer, that is.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Thanks.Ã¢â‚¬Â

1 hour later...

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“So, you got any fours?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Go shark.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn it...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ha.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'll still win, you know I wi--Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Beeping*

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“This is Lonestar, who is it?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, it's Bilnard. We're at our new ship, and it's beautiful. Dilcott, can you hear us?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm here, what is it?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“This ship, I think you're gonna like it. Lengas is on his way back now, so he should just be an hour or so.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hmm...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Alright, thanks Bilnard, Jeb out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I wonder what their ship is like, then...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Beats me.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Another hour later...

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, this is Lengas, do you copy?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm here, Lengas. You want Dilcott now?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, I'm just outside the ship. Have him EVA over here.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Why don't you just dock?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It'll take too long.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok then. You ready Dilcott?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, I'm ready. Thanks for the calming music, Handorf.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Should help you recover further. Good luck.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You too. Jeb, it's been a pleasure.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Likewise. Now go on, you have a ship to go to.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Yet another hour later...

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bilnard, we're closing in now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Roger that, we see you.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok, let's get closer, shall we?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'd say that's a good idea.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Pegasus, prepare for final approach.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Pegasus, eh?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Sounds pretty cool, doesn't it?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And here we are, buddy. Your new command.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn, that's a nice ship.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“According to the database in here, this is an Odysseus II class exploration cruiser.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And she's all yours now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wow... Lengas, it's been great to see you again.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“A mutual feeling between the two guys that took down the first Mechani-Kraken?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I only damaged it, you blasted that thing.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You helped.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“True, true... anyway, I'll see you around.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And I'm aboard. It's almost identical to--Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're under some orders, you know.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“What? And those are?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're to rename the ship. Control wants a new Odysseus out there.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Really? So it shall be, then."

Bartbert: *Clears throat* Ã¢â‚¬Å“I hope you aren't forgetting me, here.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh right. Dilcott, this is Bartbert Kerman. He flew the ship here.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bartbert? Good to meet you.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bartbert: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Likewise.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wait, you surely couldn't have flown here by yourself, not with all these advanced systems.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bartbert: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You're right, I couldn't have.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Is that my cue?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bartbert: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes, AODI, that was your cue...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI? The new Odysseus has an AI?Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I am the Advanced Offensive and Defensive Intelligence, obviously referred to as AODI. I am pleased to meet you, Dilcott.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Umm, pleased to meet you, too, I guess...Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I want it to be known that I only control the defensive and offensive measures. However, the offensive measures of this ship are currently limited to the single Krakensbane torpedo we have docked to the rear port. Defensive systems include fully upgraded shields as well as point defence lasers. Despite this, I was able to assist Bartbert in flying the ship through a toggle-able secondary system.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“So, this Odysseus isn't going down as easily, then?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I doubt the Kraken lasers will do much to this ship.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Good, good. I don't want to lose this one, really.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, I'm going to head back to the Lonestar now. Enjoy your new ship, guys.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Safe trip, Lengas.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lonestar, I'm on my way back now. Dilcott seems to be happy enough.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Good to hear. Now, we have to prepare for this wave of Kraken ships. They'll be here in a few days.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I keep running system checks, and everything's fine.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Even so, we need to be cautious. I don't want a repeat of Eeloo.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Nor do I. Your injuries were quite excessive, Jeb...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I survived, didn't I?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Only because I had to stay up for three nights in a row to make sure your vitals didn't drop.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“For which I am grateful.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, I'm bringing the lander in for docking now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Don't scratch the paintwork.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm not doing a Bob.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I heard that. Just because I damaged the rear docking port on Odysseus around Bop all those years ago doesn't mean you can bring it up now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Don't worry, it's just a joke.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I could bring up the solar panel inci--Ã¢â‚¬Â *WHACK*

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Haha, that was a good hit!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, that was...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Just don't hit me when I'm docked.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No promises, hehehe...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“There, all sorted. Malrick, I'll come and help you out now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Thanks.Ã¢â‚¬Â
Very purdy ship, Mason!
Firstly the command logs remind me of any Star Trek series. And great thing about about the new Odysseus. Does ADOI have a sense of humour?

Very purdy ship, Mason!

I agree. Very nice!

hey do you guys mind if i put a post here for destroyer design requests? I do a show and want others to put up there stock designs so i can show them off. I'm big on propriety and didn't just want to post a massive spot for my show, that's not the reason for it.
Beautiful new ship Dang, my interplanetary cruisers look like heaps of random parts threw together in a haste compared to new Odysseus.

hey do you guys mind if i put a post here for destroyer design requests? I do a show and want others to put up there stock designs so i can show them off. I'm big on propriety and didn't just want to post a massive spot for my show, that's not the reason for it.

You want people to post their destroyers, and I'm assuming myself included? I think that's fine. Just link your submissions thread for convenience, and I'll see about getting some of my military ships remade in 0.21.

To the rest of you guys, you heard the man. Destroyers, NAO

Also, the next chapter is imminent

This story is sweet. And, it updates consistently, which is a bonus.

Also, I don't have a destroyer
Don't worry if you don't have destroyers, it was just a generalised request

hey do you guys mind if i put a post here for destroyer design requests? I do a show and want others to put up there stock designs so i can show them off. I'm big on propriety and didn't just want to post a massive spot for my show, that's not the reason for it.

I have a space cruiser that I started and didn't finish/test it yet. If you want I can try and finish it for you.

CHAPTER 15: NEW ORDERS

Captains log, entry 219: A new Odysseus, eh? From what I can tell using the information in the databases, she's even more advanced than the Lonestar. Two fusion engines? It's a good thing Rodrin is a good engineer, he's going to have his hands full with those reactors. Dilcott says that the ship is a wonder to control, after he ran a test of the propulsion systems. It's been 3 days since they got there, and already they're settled in. I suppose the interior being the same has helped with that.

That said, it's been 3 days. Those Kraken forces that followed the convoy are practically on top of us now. We need to act fast. The guys at Outreach have been shoring up their defences; walls of dirt and defence turrets, the latter of which would be courtesy of one of the cargo ships. I don't know what's going to happen, but I hope its nothing bad.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm telling you, the new targeting software is fine! It isn't taking control of the ship.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“But if it does, then people will die!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You've watched that film with all those monoliths too much.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Handorf, I promise you, if any glitches occur with the software, I'll kill it. Of course, these glitches do need to be life-threatening...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Which I'm pretty sure they won't be. This isn't that AODI thing that Odysseus has on board.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Advanced Offensive and Defensive Intelligence. It's an AI. Ours isn't. Hell, ours won't even respond to inquiries.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Think of it as an upgrade to the already existing targeting computer the ship had before resupply.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok, I think I get it... still, I'm concerned.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Like I said, I'll kill it if it goes haywire.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Fine.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Aegis: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lonestar, this is the Aegis, do you read?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Aegis? I wonder what they want.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Aegis, this is Lonestar, we read you.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Aegis: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We've just engaged Kraken forces. They're here in considerable strength, avoid at all costs.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Alright, thanks for the heads up. Do you want us to try and hit them from here?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Aegis: Ã¢â‚¬Å“If you can, that would be helpful.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Malrick, power up the lasers. Bob, boot up the targeting software.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I guess it's time to see if this thing really is as hyper-accurate as we've been told.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I hope so...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lasers ready, Jeb.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bob?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I have a lock on one of the probes following the lead ship. You may fire when ready.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Alright, looks like it works. Malrick, fire.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*The lasers fire, the white hot beams screaming across space. The probe is hit and destroyed.*

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Mother of Kerbin...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“That was a direct hit!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn, this is good software!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Aegis: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lonestar, that was a fantastic shot. The probes are trying desperately to find where that blast came from. Reaper 7, take that flanker out!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Target the remaining probes and destroy them.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Target acquired. Malrick, if you would.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“But of course.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*One by one, the probes are wiped out by the beams emanating from the cannons of the Lonestar, hundreds of kilometres between them.*

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“All probes destroyed that I can see. There may be more on the other side of Duna, but it's hard to tell.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Not to worry, the military can handle the rest.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Aegis: Ã¢â‚¬Å“That we can. Your assistance was invaluable, Lonestar, thank you.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Your very welcome. Shove their metal tentacles up their backsides, would you?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Aegis: Ã¢â‚¬Å“With pleasure. Aegis out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

1 hour later...

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, control is contacting us.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh, ok. I wonder what they want.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It won't be orders to go home, there isn't a transfer window yet...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Control, it's me, what do you need?Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, it's good to hear from you again. Listen, we were wondering if you had noticed the Jool window open up a few days ago.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Umm, yes, we had noticed it. What of it?Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Odysseus has just headed off there. We want you to follow them.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“What, us? Go to Jool?Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes... you have a problem with that?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No, no, not at all! It's just that... what would we be doing there?Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Get into low Vall orbit. Odysseus is headed for Bop. By the time you both reach your positions, Vall and Bop will be aligned in such a way that you can provide fire support from a distance, if need be.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Right, because the new Odysseus isn't armed, either, really.Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Staying true to the original ship. We figured you wouldn't have approved.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Very true, although given the circumstances, I'm ok with the point-defence lasers.Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We thought so. Anyway, as soon as you can, go to Jool. Good luck Lonestar. You guys will see Kerbin again, someday. Control out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, ok then. Lengas, prep the engine, we're going to Jool.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jool? Awesome!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wait, why?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Odysseus set off to Bop to deploy the Krakensbane device. We're going to Vall to provide fire support from a distance, should the situation require it.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh, because the Old One, as they call it, is on Bop... I still remember that trip.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I bet you do, it must have been quite tense speaking to them.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, it was...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“What are the chances that the Kraken have some sort of super command ship in Bop orbit?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Quite high. They wouldn't exactly leave the Old One unprotected, nor would they have their lead ship in an easy-to-reach location.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I just hope they don't expect us to find them so we can get the drop on them.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Would be handy.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Indeed. Now, buckle up, we're burning for Jool in two minutes.Ã¢â‚¬Â

2 minutes later...

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Commencing TJI.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*The fusion engine roars into life once more*

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Trajectory is looking good.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Acceleration at 1G.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“All systems are nominal. The repairs seem to be functioning as they should.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It's been a while since we last felt the rumble of this engine. It's a good feeling.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“That it is... alright, engine cut-off. Bill, how are we looking?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jool encounter confirmed, a little over a year away.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Brilliant. You know, it feels good to be actually doing something again. Sitting here in Duna orbit for months has been incredibly boring...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I thought you liked Duna?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Of course I do. I never said Duna got boring, I said the waiting got boring.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Right, of course...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm glad we're heading to Jool again. Man, I missed that place in some ways.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It'll be a sight for sore eyes when we get there. So, while we wait... Lengas, I want my championship title back. I challenge you to Skrabble.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You're on.Ã¢â‚¬Â
Nice chapter. The engagement scenes are pretty awesome. Keep up the good work!

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“All systems are nominal.

Reactor, online.

Sensors, online.

Weapon, online.

All systems nominal.

Reactor, online.

Sensors, online.

Weapon, online.

All systems nominal.

I sure hope you aren't piloting an Atlas. My Shadowcat is only good for certain things
Atlas? Maybe....
Jeb sure does love Skrabble, doesn't he.

Cool thanks you guys here is the link to the forum post. I've also taken the time to read what you have here and it looks awesome. such a good idea.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/46669-KSP-Ship-Submitions

CHAPTER 16: ENDGAME

Captains log, entry 220: It's been a few days now since the burn. Duna is shrinking into a red dot once more. The military has practically swept Duna clean, although Outreach took a bit of a hammering and has had to be evacuated. Nearly 20 years on the surface and it's just deserted now. No doubt we'll be sending another base there in the future.

I have this feeling that, with all that has happened here, the 21st age is upon us. It wasn't all that long ago that we discovered the planets in the 17th age, and landed on Mun in the 13th. Man, we've come a very long way. I'd hate to see it all come to an end.

On an unrelated note, I still haven't reclaimed my championship title from Lengas.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¦

1 year later...

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, we're just about to enter the SOI of Jool.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“At last! How far ahead is Odysseus?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're still 10,000km in front of you. I must say, Jool is a very pretty planet.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Maybe we'll go there again soon.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Who knows? Maybe we'll even do a grand tour mission?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes. Farpoint Base is in the ideal position for that goal, but even they've had no luck. That said, they only have a smaller telescope because of space and mass requirements.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Beeping*

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lonestar here.Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, it's control. How long until you reach Vall?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Umm... 8 days? Give or take a day or two. Why?Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You remember those reinforcements the Kraken had? The first few ships have started trickling into Kerbin orbit.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“What? I thought they were still a few years away!Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Apparently no----ait, we've got prob---anding at the centre! Get everyo---ut now!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Control? Control?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

KSC: Ã¢â‚¬Å“------here, but the space cen------nder attack! Bastards managed to avoid atten------. We're evacuating, but the --ntre is go--- be ruined after this. Finish the mission, Jeb. Control ou---Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn it.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, that's not good.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I hope the military had time to sort itself out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I don't think they'd have wasted any time after the first Krakensbane went off.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Even so, the space centre is going to be a mess after this...

Meanwhile, on Odysseus...

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm glad to see that the situation has been resolved in an orderly manner.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“If you call us scrabbling for a plastic bag to scoop up a floating... err...Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Solid waste excrement.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Err, thanks....Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“My pleasure.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“ I think the point that Bilnard was going to make, AODI, was that trying to clean up the 'escapee' was anything but orderly.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I was well aware of the lack of cooperation. I merely intended a joke. I feel that this incident will be looked upon with levity in the future.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bartbert: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Joy...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The tale of the renegade excrement; an eyewitness account.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Warning, Kraken vessels detected in Bop orbit. Please proceed with caution.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Vessels? I thought we'd only have the command ship to deal with.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Sensors are showing probes in high Bop orbit, plus a few dotted around the rest of the moons.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We still have a few days before we get there, so there isn't any need to worry yet.Ã¢â‚¬Â

A few days later...

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're now in a circular Vall orbit, Jeb.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok, now we wait...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Such a waste that we're not out here to land anywhere.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I guess it would be a bad idea to do that.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“If anyone should be complaining about not being able to land on any of the moons, it should be Handorf and I. We've never been to Jool before.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes, but I must agree with Jeb on this one. It would be unfortunate if someone got hit by a laser cannon again.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I never said it was.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I hope I'm on the next manned mission to Jool.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“That's a shame. What's put you off?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Seemed appropriate.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, it's Odysseus, on comms.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Alright, put them through.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, how are you?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“In position around Vall. You?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“In Bop orbit. We've just had to blast seven probes and we're closing in on the command ship. Can you provide fire support from you current location?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bop will be in view in a few minutes, don't worry.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“As long as you're there when we need you.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Don't worry, we will be. Lonestar out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Target is on short range sensors.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI, arm the torpedo.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Torpedo arming. Warning, once the torpedo is armed, the reaction chamber is primed and cannot be shut down. Please verify that you want to arm the torpedo.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Code 1-0-4-7-9-6-A. Verify.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Torpedo armed. Warning, reaction chamber will reach critical condition in two hours if unfired.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And if that thing flees?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It won't. The Kraken are intent on getting rid of us, so I doubt their lead ship will run away.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It would appear that you mortal fools have ventured into the lair of the unforgiving once more.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“So it would seem. That said, this moon is part of our solar system, a place which you merely adopted as your 'lair'. You have no rights to lay claim to it.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“My former body rests on the surface here, so I do believe this to be my domain.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Did it just say its former body?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You can't be serious...Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh my.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes. This unit of metal and engines is merely the new conduit for my intelligence. I am what both our species refer to as the Old One. I am the original.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh frak.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And to think that my original intent was to simply isolate your puny species on that rock. It wasn't punishment enough for your intrusion. However, seeing as you've gone to all the effort of seeking me out, I may as well make your visit worthwhile. Goobye, mortals.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI?Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Defensive systems online. Shields at 100%. Point defence Lasers operational. Krakensbane torpedo will be fired on command.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lonestar, are you in firing position yet?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Almost. Give it 30 more seconds and we're good to go.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bartbert, see about diverting some power to the shields.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bartbert: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Aye.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The point defence lasers are going berserk! However, they aren't inflicting much damage.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“A petty effort. You surely realise that this unit has much improved technology to the others that I have sent out?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Dilcott, it has eight laser cannons!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Eight?! I hope the shields hold up against that.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The shields should be adequate to defend against their weapons for 2 minutes if they continuously fire for that duration. Warning, Krakensbane reaction chamber at 1% critical condition.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“OOF!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Whoa!Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Shields holding at 97.1%. No structural damage. Point defence lasers are still operational.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're in position. Bob, target that Kraken. Malrick, ready the lasers.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Target locked.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lasers ready, Jeb.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You have others lying in wait? Your species is more intelligent than was made apparent to us.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Surprised? Jeb, if you would.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Fire.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: [WARNING, SHIELDS FAILING. DIVERTING POWER TO RECHARÃ¢â‚¬â€--] Ã¢â‚¬Å“I hate those computerised commands. Now, you will pay for this, Kerbals.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Enemy shields have failed. Captain, I recommend we fire the torpedo.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI?Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes, captain?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Finish that thing off.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Torpedo launch confirmation. Warning, detonation will likely cause major damage to Odysseus systems. Please retreat to a safe distance.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You aren't having victory that easy.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*The Kraken unleashes another laser barrage, met by another salvo from Lonestar.*

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“GAH! You mortals are unworthy of this space!"

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Sorry, what's that? I can't hear you over the sound of our lasers blasting you.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jebediah Kerman. You have resisted for far too long. Now, you die.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, it's targeting us.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Odysseus, get it now!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Torpedo detonation will cause heavy damage to Odysseus systems. Please retreat to a--Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Override.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Overridden. Torpedo firing.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Now, if you don't mind, I'd quite like to run from the big scary green bomb.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Rodrin, power to the engines!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Rodrin: Ã¢â‚¬Å“There, go go go!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Another of these twisted devices?! NO! You will not prevail!Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I have the point defence lasers firing on the enemy weapons. They cannot destroy the torpedo.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AODI, take that thing down.Ã¢â‚¬Â

AODI: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Torpedo engine firing. Target confirmed. Warning, Odysseus is in range of detonation. Major system damage predicted.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken: -Indeterminable synthetic screeches- Ã¢â‚¬Å“NO, THIS ISN'T POSSIBLE.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It most certainly is possible.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh frak.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bartbert: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're in for a rough ride!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Dilcott: Ã¢â‚¬Å“ARRRGGH!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bilnard: Ã¢â‚¬Å“OOOO-----Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Gentlemen, brace yourselves.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Pulse reaches Vall, and Lonestar*

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Mother of---Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“WHOOAAAA----Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kerbin...

Bobsey: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Looks like the full torpedo just went off.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Gene: "Oh frak, really? Get everyone deeper into the bunkers, now!"

*Everyone is scrambling, the pulse clearly visible in the daytime sky.*

Gene: "Go, go go!"

32 hours later...

Atlantis: Control? Control, do -ou rea-----epeat, this is Atlantis ATL--40, do you read contr---"

*Sherrey Kerman crawls over some rubble from the old VAB towards the portable comms device.*

Sherrey: "This is... ow... this is control, we read you Atlantis. Good to see that comms are... ow... working again."

Atlantis: "I don't know who has had it wor--, you guys on the ---und, or us up here."

Gene: "I'll be betting it's you guys. Sherrey, you alright, you look a bit... battered."

Sherrey: "I'll see the doctor in a minute. Atlantis, you need anything?"

Atlantis: "I'm gonna let you know ri------- that there will be a --- of ships chiming in on the comms in a min---. They'll all be carry--- the good news."

Gene: "The good news? I do hope that news is what we want to hear..."

*Hanson climbs out of the bunker*

Hanson: "Have I missed anything...?"

Atlantis: "Admiral? That you?"

Hanson: "That would be me, Atlantis. Anything?"

Atlantis: "I may as well tell you. The Kraken are gone. We won."

Hanson: "Damn..."

Gene: "That's... that's brilliant."

Hanson: "That device sure knew what to do."

Bobsey: "I guess we can thank our 'ancients' for that one. Clever bastards..."

Gene: "Have we heard anything from Lonestar or Odysseus?"

Sherrey: "Not yet, but they were much closer to the pulse. They probably got hit much harder than us."

Gene: "I guess we'll just have to wait and see..."

Jool...

*Alarms*

Jeb: "Could somebody... turn those damn things off..."

Bob: "In a moment..."

Bill: "Oh, do I have to do everything around here?"

*Bill switches alarms off*

Jeb: "Much better, I can think straight now."

Lengas: "Head count?"

Jeb: "Jeb here."

Bill: "Bill's alive."

Bob: "Bob is hurty, but living."

Handorf: "You guys still have a doctor."

Malrick: "I'm ok."

Lengas: "That's good, no-one's dead. Lonestar has seen better days though."

Jeb: "Hmm... how long have we been out for?"

Bob: "Err... 32 hours."

Jeb: "Wow, really?"

Bill: "Jeb, Odysseus on comms, just about. It's very broken up, so good luck deciphering anything."

Jeb: "Alright..."

Dilcott: "-onesta----dysseus here. We wo------raken are gon---[CORRUPTED DATA]----emarkably littl-----amage."

Jeb: "I think I got that."

AODI: "Our communications -------------gmented and will -eed repa-----ilcott."

Dilcott: "Thanks, AODI. ----star, rendezv-------Laythe?"

Jeb: "I think I got that too. Meet you there. Lonestar out."

Handorf: "So, that's it? We've won?"

Lengas: "After all this time..."

Jeb: "Ah, the sweet taste... of victory. Bill, plot a course for Laythe. Give me a heads up of when the burn is."

Bill: "Aye, Jeb."
